subject: Boxing
lead_paragraph: The former three-time world champion Alexis Arguello has been nominated by the Sandinista party to run for mayor of Managua, Nicaragua’s capital. Arguello was approved as a precandidate for the November elections at a meeting of the Sandinista National Liberation Front, according to Daysi Torrez, a journalist who was nominated to run for deputy mayor. The selections will be ratified on Sunday by the party’s top decision-making council, and the candidates will be officially presented next week, Torrez said. Arguello, a former featherweight and lightweight champion, retired in 1995 with 80 wins in 88 fights, 64 by knockout. He was inducted into the International Boxing Hall of Fame in 1992.(AP).
